sourceDesc.p: This is the feature-file for IPFV inflection: 2sg.f in sound verbs.

revisionDesc.change: For EGY-___ there are no values found
updating references to Zotero IDs via update-bibl-refs.xsl

wib:featureValueObservation.note: This reflex appeared rarely but in speakers from both middle and old age groups.
Observed only in some speakers from the elderly group (+70), and only in defective and concave verbs in pausal position.
Panetta says that this suffix exists alongside ī but no example is provided
Due to vowel harmony, the suffix -i changes to -e in lower environments, e.g. tábde (you (f.) begin) or tilkállame (you (f.) speak).
Since all the persons in Darfur-Arabic act as communis, both forms tamsik and tamsiki can be used for both male or female. However, -i is the "original" female ending.
the prefix is d-, not t-, no GD (p.65)
